msContents.summary: Receipts for deliveries of chaff issued to Herakles and Alexandros; the chaff was delivered by Syrion and Heras, the lessees of the land in Karanis owned by the two brothers

msItem.note: Written along the fibers with 21 lines; the back is blank
Papyrus very damaged; the hand is small and very ligatured

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 139 in Bell's inventory

div.ab: Gounthos, overseer of chaff, for those going to be designated, to Herakles and Alexandros through Syrion from Karanis, greeting. I have received from you for the -th indiction for the account of citizens, [- lbs.] of chaff, - lbs. [only]. In the consulate of the consuls to be designated, for the 2nd time, Epeiph 8. (M2) I, Gounthos, have signed. Herakles and Alexandros delivered through Syrion and Heras from Karanis for the tenth indiction for the account of citizens, one thousand seven hundred forty pounds of chaff, 1740 lbs. I, Heron the overseer, have signed, through me his son Dorotheos. In the consulate of the consuls to be designated, for the 3rd time, Phamenoth 4.
